clinical_study.brief_title: cNEP for the Treatment of Obstructive Sleep Apnea
clinical_study.official_title: Continuous Negative External Pressure (cNEP) for the Treatment of Obstructive Sleep Apnea (OSA)

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine whether cNEP (continuous positive external pressure) is effective in treating obstructive sleep apnea

primary_outcome.measure: "Sustained Response" of reduction of AHI (apnea hypopnea index) at PSG (polysomnography) II
primary_outcome.time_frame: three weeks--PSG II will be done after three weeks of home use of cNEP following PSG I
primary_outcome.description: A response (either initial or sustained) is defined as an AHI that is < 50% of the qualifying PSG (polysomnography) that is also < 15/hr
Adverse events that occur during the three weeks of cNEP home use.

secondary_outcome.measure: "Initial Response" of AHI at PSG I
secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to 12 months after the qualifying PSG
secondary_outcome.description: An AHI (apnea hypopnea index) that is <50% of that of the qualifying PSG, and <15/hr at PSG I, with cNEP in place.

secondary_outcome.measure: Comparison of AHI at PSG I and PSG II
secondary_outcome.description: The AHI determined at PSG II will be compared with that of PSG I

secondary_outcome.time_frame: during each of the overnight PSGs
secondary_outcome.description: the number of minutes during the overnight PSG when SpO2 is < 90% with cNEP in place

secondary_outcome.measure: hours of home use of cNEP per night
secondary_outcome.time_frame: three weeks after initiation of home cNEP
secondary_outcome.description: the number of hours of each night at home that the subject uses cNEP

secondary_outcome.measure: Three CGI (clinical global impression) subjective measures
secondary_outcome.time_frame: three weeks after the initiation of home cNEP
secondary_outcome.description: Seven-item Likert CGI scales of three subjective measures: 1) subject's view of cNEP vs CPAP, 2) overall satisfaction with cNEP, 3) bed partner's feelings about cNEP.

arm_group.description: Subjects with OSA will be treated with cNEP (continuous negative external pressure) at home for three weeks

criteria.textblock:
Key Inclusion Criteria:
- PSG performed within the previous twelve months that documents the presence of obstructive sleep apnea (the "qualifying PSG")
- on that PSG, AHI must be 10 - 50/hr and >80% of the apneas and hypopneas must be obstructive
- no significant changes in health, medications, or lifestyle since the qualifying PSG
Key Exclusion Criteria:
- previous major surgery, injury or radiation to the neck
- beard or excessive hair on the area of the neck where the collar will be applied
- carotid artery disease
- serious medical conditions
- pregnancy
- use of home oxygen
- silicone allergy
- sleep disturbance other than obstructive sleep apnea
